content.description: Climb the corner made by the lower falls south face, and the east face of the lower canyon.  head to the left around and over some budges to an alcove, climb over the roof and up easy terrain to the top of the canyon.

The premier climb of Fossil Falls.

Start up the wide crack with some help form the pocketed face.  the crack breaks left, and turns into fists, before opening up into offwidh size again.  Reach the bivy ledge, and rest up while checking out the curving finger crack above.

Climb the broken crack to the based of the finger crack.  follow the finger crack as it curves right and thins to ring locks.  Fight the pump, find the best feet you can and power to the rim.
content.protection: single rack, a 4 is useful to protect the wide sections on the lower half.

content.description: A protectable and fun crack/corner climb. Scramble up the easy ledges and fight the bush to access the terrace and the corner system. Climb up the corner using the cracks and flakes then pull a few pockets to reach the top.
content.protection:
standard rack

2 bolts on top of the canyon rim provide an anchor, but require about 20 ft of webbing to extend the anchor over the edge of the cliff.

content.description:
The gem of this route is the overhanging hand/finger crack splitting the headwall left of Eagle.

Climb the roof left of Eagle's Talon up the lighter color right facing crack. when the rock gets bad at the bulge, traverse right and then up and left to the ledge under the overhang. Rest and power up the crack to the top.
content.protection:
Standard rack

The light colored rock in the middle of the route, has some spares gear in crumbly rock,

also there is a chance of hitting the ledge if one were to fall out of the crack at the top

Lead at your own risk.

content.description:
Climb the left facing corner to the back of the roof, work your way out to the lip of the roof, regain your balance and climb to the intermediate anchors on the ledge (40ft)

From the follow the crack up and right passing old fixed gear, and continue up easy terrain to rim, OR go back left up the wide crack, then further left along the diagonal thin hands crack to the rim directly over the start of the climb.
content.protection:
single rack, extra in the small hand sizes.

The wide crack in the upper half can take a 4 and 5.

content.description:
An easy ramp climb with only two moves of 5th class climbing, a slab move down low, and a gaston in the middle. Most of the ramp is 4th/3rd.

Due to the traversing nature of the ramp, it is not a good TR climb.  However it is a great way to access to the top of the east side of the lower falls for anchoring the other climbs there
content.protection: standard rack, natural features for an anchor.

content.description: Climb the roof left of Eagle underneath the thin seam splitting the wall above.  climb out of the roof, swing around the corner onto the face and climb up the crack to a small ledge where the seam begins.  Find the good finger pockets, and fire the seam crack passing a small wedged rock.  Join up with Eagle at the nest and climb textured hand crack above to the rim.
content.protection:
Best done as a top rope.

the seam crack could take some very small gear, but the rock quality is suspect.

content.description: Start with a boulder problem off the ground a few feet left of Ride of the Valkyries.  Continue up the wide crack and follow the roof as it curves out to the left.  Pass the "Eagles" nest and climb the very textured hand crack to the rim.
content.protection: Trad, a 4 is very useful, and a 5 could be used in many spots, but isn't necessary.

content.description:
climb up the corner/chimney feature, stemming is useful. Pull up out of the corner and climb the easy crack to the midway anchors.

From here there are two options to reach the upper balcony.

Option 1: go more or less straight up and climb the fist sized crack.

Option 2: Traverse right to the cracked arête, and climb up the bolt protected finger crack as it widens to great hands

Both options feel about the same in difficulty ***Option 2 has  lost the blocks on the arete that made the finger crack and inside side pulls between the second and third bolt.  the difficulty of this section is now significantly harder***

Once you reach the balcony, there is still about 10ft of climbing up the crack at the back of the balcony which gets you to the top of the canyon.
content.protection:
standard rack, a #4 is good for option 1

option 2 has 4 bolts on the lower section of the arete to aviod the possiblity of damaging the stack of compressed blocks that froms the right hand arete.

bolts at the top of the canyon to make an anchor

content.description: Climb up the series of ledges at the southern end of the west wall.
